content.raw:
Nice, this fixes it for me!

> I don't this using OneTimeChange is necessarily bad

One downside I can think of is that if the log sample rate is very high, this could impact the playback speed significantly. 

> it would be nice if other systems could know that log playback is active/enabled. Then a system could make decisions on how to process information.

I can see this being more general than just playback. For example, the network primary may have a lower update rate and we end up needing a similar solution. I think that using `OneTimeChange` for (potentially) low frequency updates is a good temporary solution.
content.html:
Nice, this fixes it for me!

I don't this using OneTimeChange is necessarily bad

One downside I can think of is that if the log sample rate is very high, this could impact the playback speed significantly.

it would be nice if other systems could know that log playback is active/enabled. Then a system could make decisions on how to process information.

I can see this being more general than just playback. For example, the network primary may have a lower update rate and we end up needing a similar solution. I think that using OneTimeChange for (potentially) low frequency updates is a good temporary solution.
